To solve this problem, we need to calculate both fractions (one third) separately because these actions affect different groups of penguins simultaneously without interaction. Let’s break it down into steps:

Step 1: Calculate one-third who jumps in and swims in the ocean.  
One-third of the penguins would be \( \frac{1}{3} \times 296509 \) which equals approximately 98836 penguins. These penguins no longer sunbathe since they went swimming.

Step 2: Calculate another one-third going inside the cavern to eat their dinner. This group won't include any previously counted penguins as they represent new members joining those already accounted for under previous calculations or overlapping scenarios; thus, let us also compute \(\frac{1}{3} \times 296509\) here too. Again, about 98836 penguins head towards the caves.
